intro: Cratylia hypargyraea, commonly known as the silverleaf cowpea, is a leguminous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It features compound leaves with a distinctive silvery-gray pubescence, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its pod-like fruits contain edible seeds that are rich in protein. Cratylia hypargyraea is often used in traditional agriculture for soil enrichment due to its nitrogen-fixing ability.
